item.title: My Best Friend’s Affair Is Eating at Me. Should I Tell?
item.description: I hoped it would end. It hasn’t.

item.title: Can You Force Your Children to Bury You in Some Weird Way?
item.description: A ruling on San Diego-style reef burials.

item.title: How to Make Art Out of Confederate Monuments
item.description: A new show featuring decommissioned statues dispels myths of American history at a moment when President Trump is insisting on them.

item.title: After an Injury, I Had to Wear Adult Diapers. Now, I Kind of Miss Them.
item.description: How regression taught me to live a grown-up life.

item.title: Today’s ‘Skinny Influencers’ Are Selling Something More Mind-Bending Than Weight Loss
item.description: They peddle a deeper fantasy: that you can stop thinking about food at all. But their advice seems to have the opposite effect.

item.title: This Vibrantly Green Rice Is Also a Feast for the Eyes
item.description: Rich with kale and halloumi, this elegant rice dish is special enough for just about any occasion.

item.title: I Co-Parent My Kids. Would It Be Wrong to Move Abroad?
item.description: How should I weigh my children’s emotional needs against my own need for healing, belonging and growth?

item.title: What’s More Famous: ‘Jaws’ or ‘The Godfather’?
item.description: A ruling on the most subjective and inane dispute of all time.

item.title: Jennifer Lawrence Regrets Everything She’s Ever Said or Done
item.description: At only 35, the actress has been through the celebrity wringer. Here’s where she landed.

item.title: ‘I’m the Guy on the Floor’: Memories From a Thrilling Marathon Finish
item.description: A dramatic late-race twist in 1983’s New York City Marathon left one runner triumphant, and another on his back. Here’s what they remember.

item.title: Everyone Hates ‘Friend,’ the A.I. Necklace. But the A.I. Isn’t the Problem.
item.description: A wearable companion is a brilliant idea — in theory.

item.title: How Should I Deal With My Horrendous Sister-in-Law?
item.description: No one calls her out for her deceitful, violent, abusive behavior.

item.title: She Was Ready to Have Her 15th Child. Then Came the Felony Charges.
item.description: MaryBeth Lewis’s desire to be a new mom again, at 65 years old, led to a custody battle like no other.
